Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for, except...”
Reviews.Author: Martailer
Reviews.Content: As most other reviewers of this hotel, I really liked the place. Some complain that it's noisy but when you choose an hotel located at Istanbul's equivalent of NYC's Times Square area, who's to blame? The hotel or the person who actually decided to rent there??? In this city of 14 million people, the hotel is located right in the heart of the city's nightlife area, everywhere in the city is much calmer. The hotel staff is friendly, the rooms are bright and clean, internet is free, fast and always on, the hotel is safe (left money, my laptop, a tablet, a camera and a phone in the room and no one ever touched it in the 5 days I stayed there). I almost only have good things to say and will definitely go back to this hotel at the time of my next visit. Everything was perfect except the following: - Breakfast is the same every morning (waitress is very nice) - A friend of mine called 4 times and talked in Turkish with the front desk staff, he left messages for me each time to the employees but nobody ever transmitted his messages to me nor notified me of a message. - Although there is absolutely no dust in the room of in the bathroom, accumulated dirt on the white ceramic floor of the bathroom made the tiles go dark gray all along the walls. It would need to be scrubed thoroughly. - Single room is 110 Euro directly with them and $110 USD on Expedia but if you buy from Expedia you get room on noisier first floor.... They keep the higher floors for people who pay more, even when the hotel is not even half full. Well insulated so not bad anyway.

Reviews.Title: “what a pity: cosy but very very noisy”
Reviews.Author: fabio042
Reviews.Content: The odda hotel is really a very nice place with its old charming atmosphere, good stilish furniture, well equipped rooms and, first of all, a quite efficient service. However is located in one of the most noisy place in Istanbul, just in the heart of an area full of music pubs screaming till late in the night. Sleeping becomes an hard think to do even if the rooms are equipped with very good soundproofed windows. It is a pity

Reviews.Title: “It was "alright" but..........”
Reviews.Author: TabSea
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the Odda hotel on April 5th- pretty late @ night- was greeted by the night manager & we were taken to our room on a high floor (6th recommended- more on that later)....... We reserved a suite & were "confirmed" a suite, but was taken to a room- called the front desk- said they made a mistake & that we would be switched "tomorrow". Ok- we were tired & settled in. It was pretty warm- no A/C- the night manager said it would be turned on "tomorrow"....... He said "open the window" UH- let me explain the area..... There are NUMEROUS night clubs/bars downstairs from the hotel with music PUMPING (the bars close between 3-4AM)- this is one of the party areas of the city- I think this is what it would be like staying ON Bourbon St. in New Orleans during Mardi Gras..... Yes- its that loud...... SO- since we werent going to be going to bed very soon- we decided to pop open some wine...... no corkscrew in the room, or wine glasses- called the night manager again- he would have them sent up with some ice- arrived quickly from the expressionless bellhop who commented that he wanted a tip...... LOL!!! So to recap- we didnt get our confirmed suite, there was no A/C, its VERY loud @ night- not the greatest start. So- the next day- we didnt fully unpack since we were going to be moved- went out & about for most of the day came back to be told- we would not be moving....... GRRRRR!!!! "Tomorrow" we were told....... they said we would not be charged the suite price- so they made it right. Still no A/C- we were given some reason about they didnt use enough heat over the winter & they have to wait or something- I still dont know...... Maybe "tomorrow"???? Although- we were thinking being up on the 6th floor we were farther away from the night club thumping going on downstairs. Anyway, enough about our issues. Hotel was clean, rooms nice, comfy beds, nice linens, nice pillows, free WIFI throughout the hotel. Bathrooms could have been a little cleaner- porcelain sinks should shine!!! And the water glass on the sink should also be clean.... Bathrooms dont have much room for a toiletry kit to put anywhere- so we had to keep our toiletries out on the desk in the room. Good showers though- nice water pressure. Soaps & shampoos were alright- nothing fancy. Suggest you bring your own bar soap though- the soap you get there is nice but pretty small. Breakfast was adequate, assortment of meats & cheeses, juices & coffee- a strange breakfast room though- the layout..... Nicely decorated though & fine. We were moved to our suite for our last night & it was nice- on a lower floor closer to the clubs- but the windows closed do cut down on the outside noise- so you have to decide- noise or temperature.......???? We chose the temp & just flung them all open since we were going to be up- after all we got back @ about 2AM- nice cross breeze. Room could have used some touches though- like a dimmer switch for the light- this was a beacon!!!! Strange that the shower was IN the bedroom...... Dont get me wrong- the area out side the hotel is great if you are into that sort of thing- & we are- but to stay in the middle of it- not so much. Doesnt make for great nights sleep if you want to get up early in the AM to go exploring....... We did notice there werent many residential apartments in this area- all the other buildings around the Odda were dark- the only ones with lights on were hotel's or guesthouses. Great bars & restaurants right outside the door of the hotel & its very centrally located- easy access to taxis & the main shopping street it about a 5 min walk away- Taksim Sq. is about a 10 min walk as well. Given our "hotel challenges", Istanbul is a FANTASTIC city- we cant wait to go back but would certainly stay a quieter area & perhaps a more "established" hotel that doesnt keep telling their guests "tomorrow"......

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: siyosh
Reviews.Content: The greatest Hotel in Istanbul. Best location, great interior, friendly services and very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & sweet hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lia K
Reviews.Content: We would reccomend this hotel to everyone, because it is located in the middle of Istiklal street, it is very clean, the personnel is very friendly, polite and helpful. The rooms are very pleasant and comfortable. We were 3 friends from THESSALONIKI.

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest location ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lena189852
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t tell but you will find out for sureâ€¦ the location is spot on to a massive amount of bars which all play painfully very loud music, during weekends until 5 o clock in the morning. The hotel itself is quite nice, itâ€™s new, beds are very comfortable, room size is okay, but still this is not a hotel I would recommend due to the noise. The soundproofed windows didnâ€™t fix it, Friday and Saturday night was just too much. Nescafe was served for breakfast which isnâ€™t what you expect, over all the breakfast wasnâ€™t a hit so we went out to a nearby cafÃ© instead. There was a not so pleasant smell in the bathroom and the lamp above the mirror we fixated by attaching a pencil to hold it in place. Doesnâ€™t the maintenance notice these things while cleaning the rooms? The negative parts are unfortunately what we remember the most and I strongly tell people to stay out of this area, book a room at Taksim Square instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a four-star one”
Reviews.Author: Vadim0001
Reviews.Content: ODDA hotel is well located one block from Istiklal street. It is well-furnished and clean with friendly staff. However, the hotel is by no means a four-star establishment: no pool or gym, basic cafe, no room service, minimal bathroom items. I booked a king-size bed, but the receptionist told they only have twins. Which was okay for a single person, but I don't imagine two people arranging themselves on a bed so small. Noise from nearby discos is very strong in the room until about 4am. So not much chance to get asleep before that, and I never managed to wake up for breakfast, which is until 10am.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Flowernessa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights while visiting Istanbul for an academic conference. As a solo female traveler, I was extremely happy with this lovely hotel and its friendly staff. My room was very clean and comfortable (and I am really picky and finicky about clean hotel rooms) and the location, in terms of getting around, was fantastic. The only problem for me, was the noise coming from the clubs and the bars on the street below. If you are coming to Istanbul to party, I am guessing this location will be perfect for you- you can stay out late and sleep in! I had to be at the university every morning and the noise definitely kept me up. That being said, the value was great and I have no regrets about staying here! I recommend it whole heartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: sinderella12
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. I was a bit disappointed in the size of the room however the photos give the impression of spaciousness. There were no standard rooms left when we booked so we had to take a deluxe. While the bathroom was large the room itself was tiny - I hate to think how small the standard rooms are. Having said that our stay was very comfortable. The bed was lovely especially after a hard day's shopping and the air conditioning/heating was appreciated. Breakfast was OK too but the filter coffee had run out on the first morning and not replenished. This hotel is well positioned for bars, cafes and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations from the heart, you were fantastic..!”
Reviews.Author: BarisAvsar
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days at the ODDA Hotel. The stay was really nice and so are the staff, in the end I was almost sorry to leave. Upon arriving I found myself in a valley of smiles from the very first person I met Emre. First thing I asked him who did the design of this hotel, because if you are an engineer or architect you would have noticed the taste. I loved the perfect interior design and perfect decoration. Later on he introduced me to the staff and they explained everything I had available. Entering the room, it was clean and perfectly designed. The bathroom is also spacious and very clean. The bed was one thing that if I could take her home, I would have done. Hard in the right places and comfortable.... Very rich and tasty breakfast, I love scrambled eggs, and I found the best around. . With each breakfast I became more spoiled and I was late for one of my meetings because of this perfect breakfast :) Well I didnâ€™t want to leave :) As far as location, you are on the right trackâ€¦ 5 minutes to famous Istiklal Street. Everything is there, everywhere is there. Well I saved lots of money because of being at the location which is close to everywhere so I didnâ€™t need any cab, but of course I spent that money on drinks :) There are a lot of things that made me enjoy my stay at this hotel, but my warmest congratulations to the Hotel for their choice of personnel. They know how to really make you feel at home, and if you need anything it is like asking a family member. Congratulations from the heart, you were fantastic. Baris A.

Reviews.Title: “nice design but lot's of trouble”
Reviews.Author: minimebee
Reviews.Content: All in all a nicely desined hotel (if you don't look at the horrible pictures in the breakfast room, might have been put there by a taste free management and can not have been intention of the architect) with small rooms in a lively area. the downsize of the stay was that the hotel staff gave our suitecases from the storage room to an italian tourist group. we where lucky that the italian tourists brought the luggage back hours later, but this was totally unneccessary stress and should not happen. although the staff was nice and helpfull, but this should not happen in a well organized hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Anne F
Reviews.Content: I do confirm that the rooms are nicely decorated, the location is great, the staff is very kind but I do also confirm that there is too much noise !! Even if you change your room for a room on the last floor, as I did, it is still very noisy!! It is just like being in the middle of a night club during all night! The only way I could get some sleep was to put earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Noise Was Too Much”
Reviews.Author: upwego2
Reviews.Content: The Good: - New hotel - Simple and elegant decor - Very clean washrooms and rooms - Excellent hotel management and staff...wonderful people - Fabulous location (close to shops, restaurants and cafes) The Not So Good: -Breakfast was very simple with options of cheese, boiled eggs, bread and olives - The hotel should invest in an egg station to cook fresh eggs - any style The Bad: - The noise level...was...REALLY...bad at night. We did not sleep well as the noise continued until early into the morning. The hotel staff tried to help but it's really out of their hands as the hotel is in a nightlife/clubbing district. Great hotel but because of the noise level I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: nzny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few steps away from Istiklal road in Taksim -- which is a great location for restaurants, nightlife, strolling around, and access to Metro and Tram. The hotel is brand new with great interior design. The service was really accommodating as well. It gets loud at night, as it is near many bars and clubs. Overall, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ODDA HOTEL in my point of view”
Reviews.Author: hamed842
Reviews.Content: i was in odda hotel for around 3 weeks,and i searching too many times for all hotel and motel which was located close to shoping centure and taksim squar,but i swear odda hotel was really really nice hotel in comparison with the others.all of stuff and personals were nice and really kind,you couldnt imagine what im talking about ,cause you have vist there and you will understand what im talking about,hotel design was really high class,rooms dominated by white and gray colors, a bit traditional and some modern designed which was fantastic ,i really love this hotel,i extremlly recommend this hotel to all tourism which wanna visit istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: jesse j
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul with my boyfriend for my 40th birthday this past week. One of the best parts of our trip was ODDA Hotel! It was our home away from home: clean, cool, great view, excellent decor, lots of individual attention and care, new, great location. On the evening of my birthday the staff sent a chocolate banana birthday cake to my room! It was such a surprise, and it made me feel so special and appreciated as a customer. The location is fun and active - full of locals living the Istanbul life. Five stars! HIGHLY recommend despite the complaints about price.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT PRICEY”
Reviews.Author: IOANNISMI
Reviews.Content: Excellent location , nicely decorated rooms , very clean , but pricey when compared to european standards .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to discover Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: V T
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this lovely & brand new hotel in the middle of modern Istanbul, located in the middle of numerous bars and clubs, and nearby a shopping area. The neighborhood is very lively but our room on the 4th floor was well soundproofed and quiet. The room was very pleasant, with a very comfortable bed, trendy decoration, and a nice bathroom with a large shower. Add a very friendly and welcoming staff, always available and willing to help, and you have the ingredients of a great stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TDHArizona
Reviews.Content: I have been to Istanbul four times in the last two years and I like to try different places to stay. So many of the travel books tend to encourage tourists to stay in the Sultanahmet area. As a solo female traveler, I prefer other areas like Taksim for many reasons. Odda is in a location I prefer because close to many trendy, fun restaurants and very easy to get to the touristy areas either by tram or taxi in minutes. I love being able to blend in with locals and not be pestered by annoying men in the touristy area. Odda is a lovely hotel that you are sure to have an enjoyable stay. Rooms and staff are quite lovely.

Reviews.Title: “ODDA Hotel Istanbul.....Boutique Luxury Atmosphere for a tight Budget”
Reviews.Author: jackwnoho
Reviews.Content: For weeks and weeks leading up to my trip to Istanbul I monitored the hotels and resorts in Istanbul for a place to stay. The popular ones like the Hilton, Pera Palace, Marmara etc. seemed to always get less than perfect reviews for the prices they were asking. Only days before my departure I found the ODDA Hotel and booked it for half the cost of the popular hotels. ODDA is a brand new boutique hotel in the heart of Taksim near the shopping, restaurants, and nightlife and only about a 30 minute walk to the historic side for sightseeing (or 10 minutes by metro). I figured that since it was new it would be clean and it was indeed very clean. My only concern was knowing it's location in the heart of the "action" there would be noise from the bars and clubs, but when I closed my balcony door and windows the thick sound proof glass completely sealed out the noise for almost complete silence. I was amazed! Some evenings it was nice to have the windows open to hear the hustle and bustle of exciting Taksim while I was unwinding or getting ready to go out, but when I was ready to go to sleep I just closed the windows for peace and quiet. The staff at the ODDA were all very friendly and hospitable and most speak english too. The breakfast, which was included every morning was terrific, featuring cereals and breads, baked treats, and meats and cheeses and olives as well. There really isn't anything negative I have to say about the hotel, it's charming and cute. If you want a pool and a hotel bar and a fitness center than better go to one of the chains like the hyatt, hilton, intercontinental etc., But if are in Istanbul to see and experience the great culture and history and people, then ODDA Hotel is a perfect choice. And, they pick you up from the airport as well so you don't have to worry about a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “I loved very much I'll back very soon”
Reviews.Author: Muradhan
Reviews.Content: First of all location is the best where it is!They are very friendly and service was perfect. Rooms are very bright and comfortable i'm so happy to stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Taksim”
Reviews.Author: kdsNYC_11
Reviews.Content: ODDA Hotel is a stylish, new, contemporary boutique hotel in the heart of Taksim. My friends and I could't have picked a better spot to stay. The staff was very friendly, the hotel itself was spotless and the location (lots of restaurants and shops close by) made it a perfect spot to celebrate a birthday in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “So accommodating Stunning hotel Friendly staff Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TotallyTopkapi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning in the modern part of Istanbul very hassle free. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from the main street. Where you will find superb shopping excellent roof top restaurants with stunning views and bustling bars and cafÃ©'s. This is a hassle free chilled out area of Istanbul the hotel staff are friendly warm and welcoming and will arrange personal guides,trips transfers and even printed out our on-line check-in slips for us. No request was to much for them we were really looked after. The staff have a cosmopolitan and respectful attitude to their guests. Our suite was luxurious spacious and beautifully designed. The hotel is owned by Turkeys No 1 premier footballer so no expense has been spared the interiors have been designed by two members of his family who are architects and interior designers. It really is a spectacular Boutique hotel and we will be returning again very soon. many thanks to all the staff for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, convenient location and very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Brightontoknighton
Reviews.Content: A brand new boutique hotel in a great location. We had a deluxe suite and it was well worth the extra for a top quality suite. We booked a private car from the airport which made it extra easy to get to the hotel. The reception staff were amazing and arranged a private guide for us for the following day which gave us the best time, got us to the front of the queues at Topkapi, Agia Sophia etc and gave us the confidence to "go solo" the next day using public transport etc. The location is perfect - just off the main shopping street, but the double glazing kept the street sounds down to a minimum, and there are lots of restaurants and shops nearby. This part of the city is an exotic mix of styles and the locals are more relaxed and it was hassle free. We stayed for a three night city break which gave us the flavour of the city and we will be back to stay at the Odda hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Smell old Istanbul , Live Istanbul Nights , Feel the comfort”
Reviews.Author: tiye34
Reviews.Content: Pretty good welcoming hugs you whenever you go inside this old traditonal Istanbul building. Professional staff and great smileof the Owner ' s makes you that you are at the correct place Hotel is so new brand just a few weeks old .Rooms dominated by white and gray colors, a bit traditional and some modern designed. You find peace and have a great sleep in this bed after a busy , rush day . Although hotel is located at the one of the most busy streets of BeyoÄŸlu due to sound-proof windows music sound never botheres you by night. I like the the place of the aircondition a lot. It doesnt blow you directly and make you sick . Hotel has free airport transfer at that period if you stay 3 or more nights which was great. For sure you will like the breakfast area. You will love healthy , organic fresh vegetables , olives comes from Bursa. This really makes you feel that this management gives you real importance. Thank you Odda Hotel. See you next time

HotelInfo.Name: ODDA Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Balo Sok. | no:30, Istanbul 34435, Turkey
